intro: Rhexia pityrophylla, commonly known as the yellowroot sorrel, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are edible and have a mildly sour taste, similar to sorrel. Rhexia pityrophylla thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in woodland habitats.
